analytic.title: The Syriac Marriage Ritual in the Trilingual Manuscript from Beijing/Taipei

biblStruct.note: The article provides the publication of the Betrothal and Marriage service which forms part of a manuscript of the late Yuan period, at present located in Taipei, but formerly in Beijing. Other parts of the manuscript contain short addresses to saints, East Syriac anaphoral prayers, and select Psalms. The text of the Betrothal and Marriage service is multilingual: while the main text of the service in Syriac, there is a section in New Persian (which will be published separately) and there are glosses in Uyghur. A comparison of the structure of the Betrothal and Marriage services with that of the rite of the Church of the East indicates several marked differences, as well as certain basic similarities.
